superEntry.entry:
4 A^ayotamahu *
[He made him fatherless]. (TA in art. Aym.) See an ex. in art. Aym, conj. 2.

waladatohu yatonA *
She brought him forth feet foremost. (M.) In Fresnel's three copies of the Aghánee, (see his “ Seconde lettre sur l'Histoire des Arabes avant l'Islamisme, ” Journal Asiatique, 3rd Series, no. 16,) erroneously written nynA.

A_iyvamu *
and tiyvamu [for A=vamu and taA^ovamu]: see A^avima.

yadN *
The arm, from the shoulder-joint to the extremities of the fingers. (Msb.) ― -b2- [The foreleg of a horse, &c.] ― -b3- yadN bayoDaA='u: see A^aboyaDu, in two places, near the end of the paragraph. ― -b4- yadN A sleeve: see R. Q. 1 in art. *b. ― -b5- yadu Alqawosi: see rijolN, in two places. ― -b6- TiwaAlu AlA^ayodi for AlA^ayodiY: see vamaAniyapN. ― -b7- A^aEoTaAhu Eano yadK, as occurring in the Kur, ix., 29, He gave it in acknowledgement of the superiority of the receiver; that the power (yado) of the latter was superior to that of the giver: or, because of favour received; or, from subjection and abasement: (M:) or, from compulsion: (A 'Obeyd, T:) or, obediently: or, walking with it; not riding, nor sending it: or, in ready money. (TA.) ― -b8- A^asolama EalaY yadaYo fulaAnK He became a Muslim by the advice and persuasion of such a one. (Marg. note in a copy of the Jámi' es-Sagheer, on a trad. commencing mano A^asolama.) ― -b9- A^axa*t~u Einodahu yadFA: see art. Ax*. ― -b10- lifulaAnK EinodiY yadN I owe such a one a benefit. ― -b11- EalaY yadihi By his agency, or means. See the corresponding expression in Hebrew, in Ps. lxiii. 11, Jer. xviii. 21, and Ezek. xxxv. 5, in the phrase “ to pour out (the blood of) a person by means of the sword. ” ― -b12- walaA tuloquwA biA^ayodiykumo A_ilaY Alt~aholukapi (Kur, ii. 191): see b (used redundantly). ― -b13- lA A=tiyhi yada Ald~ahori, and yada Almusonadi I will not come to him, or do it, ever; I will never do it. (IAar, in I., voce musonadN.) See A^abadN and jadFA. ― -b14- EalaY yadaYi Alxayori waAlyumoni: see xayorN. ― -b15- biEotuhu yadFA biyadK: see naAjizN. ― -b16- You say, also, baAyaEotuhu yadFA biyadK, the two nouns being only thus used, as a denotative of state, I contracted a sale with him for ready money; i. q. biAlt~aEojiyli waAln~aqodi. (Mgh.) ― -b17- laka A^ano yakuwna ka*aA [or yadaY~a?] yadiY~a is like EalaY~a lk An ykwn k*A. (Aboo-Sahl El-Harawee, TA in art. Hbq.) ― -b18- A^utiYa EalaY yadi fulaAnK: see A^ataY. ― -b19- A^aw~ala *iY yadayoni and *aAti yadayoni: see art. *w. ― -b20- taHota yadihi Under his authority. ― -b21- yadN (assumed tropical:) Generosity. (A, voce $aborN)

mayodiY~N *
A gazelle whose fore-leg is caught in a snare: see marojuwlN.

AljaAru AlyarobuwEiY~u *
: see AljAr AlbaraAqi$iY~u, in art. brq$.

yaraAEN *
A firefly: see HubaAHibN.

yaraqaAnN *
Saffron. (Sgh, in TA, art. $Er.) ― -b2- See A^araqaAnN.

yaramiY~N *
and A^ayoramiY~N A sign-stone: see A_iramN.

yazaniY~N *
and A^ayozaniY~N, applied to a spear: see A^azoA^aniY, in art. zA^n.

4 maA A^ayo$amahu *
How unlucky! a vulgarism: see 4 in art. $A^m.

yafaEN *
: see yaAfiEN

yafaEapN *
: see yaAfiEN

yafaAEN *
: see yaAfiEN

yaAfiEN *
and yafaEapN↓ A boy grown up, (Msb, TA,) grown tall; (Ham, p. 354 et seq., Har, p. 189;) as also yafaAEN↓ and yafaEN↓. (Ham, ibid.) See an ex. voce xaboA^apN; and $aAdixN and muTab~ixN.

waladu AlmuyaAfaEapi *
[The offspring of fornication, or adultery].

1 yaqinahu *
, (S, Msb, K,) and yaqina bihi; (Msb;) and A^ayoqanahu↓, (S, K,) and bihi Ayqn↓; (K;) and tayaq~anahu↓; and Aisotayoqanahu↓, (S, Msb, K,) and Astyqn↓ bihi; (K;) all signify the same; (S;) He knew it; he was, or became, certain, or sure, or he made sure, of it; syn. Ealimahu; (Msb, K;) intuitively, and inferentially; (Msb;) [see 1 in art. Elm;] and taHaqaq~ahu. (K.)

4 A^ayoqana
see 1.

5 tayaq~ana
see 1.

10 A_isotayoqana
see 1.

yaqiynN *
is of the measure faEiylN in the sense of the measure faAEilN, signifying Sure, or certain,
and manifest. (Msb.) ― -b2- And knowledge, or certainty; [see Zan~N;] instinctive and inferential. (Msb.) ― -b3- Eayonu Alyaqiyni: see EayonN (latter part). ― -b4- AlHq~u Alyaqiynu and Haq~u Alyaqiyni: see jaAmiEN; where the two words are said to have the same meaning: and Bd and Jel in lvi. 95; in the latter of which, Alyqyn in Haq~u Alyaqiyni is expressly said to be an epithet: see also Ham, p. 335.

2 yam~ama *
: see A^am~ama. And yam~ama AlmariyDa and Almay~ita: see Mgh in art. A^am~a.

5 tayam~ama *
: see SaEiydN and art. Am. ― -b2- tayam~ama yamaAmapF i. q. qaSada qaSodFA. (TA in art. Am.)

AlfariyDapu Alyam~iy~apu *
: see Almu$ar~akapu.

yamaAmN *
: see HamaAmN.

yaAmurrN *
The male of the A^ay~il [or mountain goat: not l: A]. (M, TT.)

1 yumina *
, (T, M, K,) and yamina, (M, K,) He was prosperous; fortunate; lucky. (T, M, K.)

3 yaAmana *
: see 3 in art. $A^m in two places.

4 A^ayomanahu *
He made it to incline towards the right: see an ex. voce sin~N (near the end of the paragraph). ― -b2- A^ayomana: see A^a$oA^ama in two places. ― -b3- A^ayomanotu A_ibiliY: see A^ayosarotu.

5 tayam~ana *
He was placed on his right side in the grave. (TA, voce EalobaY.) ― -b2- tayam~ana bihi i. q. tabar~aka bihi [q. v.]. (S.) ― -b3- fulaAnN yutayam~anu biraA^oyihi, i. e. yutabar~aku bihi, (T,) app. One is fortunate in, or derives a blessing from, his counsel. ― -b4- He augured good by it, or from it; or looked for good fortune, or a blessing, from it; syn. tab~araka bihi: (Mgh, Msb, &c:) opposed to ta$aA^'ama bihi, in the K, art. Tyr; and in Bd, xvii. 14; and well known. ― -b5- tayam~ana bikalimapK [He augured good from the word], (Har, p. 488,) and bikalaAmK. (Msb. in art. fA^l.)

6 tayaAmana *
: see ta$a~aAma. ― -b2- tayaAmanuwA: see 3 in art. ysr.

yumonN *
Prosperity; good fortune; good luck; auspiciousness; (T, S, M, K;) contr. of $uw^omN, (M,) and of naHosN. (L, art. sEd.)

yumonapN *
: its pl. seems to be yumanN. See burodN.

Alyamiynu *
The location that is on the right. ― -b2- yamiynN also, The south. See saroHN. ― -b3- yamiynu also signifies A covenant (Bd, and Jel in lxviii. 39) confirmed by an oath. (Bd, ibid.) yamiynu A@ll~`hi The oath by attestation of God: see A^ayomu A@ll~`hi, and Eahodu A@ll~`hi. ― -b4- Halafotu yamiynFA [I swore, or have sworn, an oath]. (T, S, M, voce A^amiynN, which see. You say, yamiyna A@ll~`hi laA A^afoElu (as in some copies of the S [meaning, Halafotu yamiyna A@ll~`hi]): or yamiynu A@ll~`hi (as in other copies [meaning, yamiynu A@ll~`hi qasamiY]). See a similar form of oath voce HaraAmN. ― -b5- yamiynFA SaAdiqapF laA^afoEalan~a: see zaEompN.

yamaAnK *
A garment of Yemen: see a verse voce tasohiymN.

yamaAniY~N *
and yamaAnuwna: see tihaAmiY~N.

yaAminN *
: see yaAsirN.

A^ayomanu *
[The right, as opposed to the left; see Kur, xix. 53, xx. 82, and xxviii. 30:] contr. of A^ayosaru; and [in like manner] mayomanapN↓ is contr. of mayosarapN. (S.) ― -b2- A^ayomanu, contr. of A^a$oA^amu, as signifying The right, opposed to the left: and as signifying Lucky, or auspicious: pl. A^ayaAminu. See A^a$oA^amu. ― -b3- It is also used in the sense of yumonN: see A^a$oA^amu. ― -b4- Also More, and most, lucky, or auspicious, or happy: see 8 in art. fy^l.

A^ayomunN *
, used only in swearing, is a sing. noun, not a particle, nor pl. of yamiynN: and is derived from yumonN. (Mughnee.)

AlA^ayaAminu *
: see an ex. of this word, voce vaAbirN.

mayomanapN *
The right wing of an army. See A^ayomanu.

mayomuwnN *
Fortunate; happy; (T, M, MA, KL;) blest. (T.) See an ex. voce EariykapN.

tayam~unN *
The having [or receiving] a blessing. (K L.)

tiyman~aA *
for taA^oman~aA: see A^aminahu.

yanamapN *
: see HalamapN.

yawomN *
A time, whether night or day; (Msb;) time absolutely, whether night or not, little or not: this is the proper signification: (Kull, p. 390:) and day, meaning the period from the rising of the sun to its setting; (Lth, TA:) the time when the sun is above the earth: this is the common conventional acceptation: (Kull, ubi suprà:) and the period from the second [or true] dawn to sunset: (Msb, Kull:) this is the legal acceptation: (Kull:) and a civil day: the period of the revolution of the greatest firmament. (Kull) ― -b2- Also, An accident, or event; syn. kawonN and kaAy^inapN. Ex., niEoma A@loA^axu fulaAnN fiY Alyawomi A_i*aA nazala binaA Excellent is the brother, such a one, in the case of the accident, when it befalls us. (T.) ― -b3- See nahaArN. ― -b4- yaA^otiynaA yawoma yawoma He comes to us day after day, i. e., every day: (Sharh esh-Shudhoor:) and yawoma yawomK. (In a verse cited by IJ. in Mz, sect. on the Haqiyqap and majaAz.) ― -b5- yawomN A dayjourney, or day's journey. ― -b6- A day, as in our phrase “ he won the day; ” meaning contest, fight, or battle: I render it a day [of conflict]. ― -b7- A^ay~aAmu AlEarabi The [days, (agreeably with an English, as well as Arabian, usage,) meaning] conflicts (waqaAy^iE) of the Arabs. (ISk, T.) ― -b8- Aibonu yawomihi He who thinks [only of the present day,] not of the morrow. (Er-Rághib. in TA, art. bnY.) ― -b9- yawomu Al$~ak~i: see $ak~N. ― -b10- bayon AlA^ay~aAmi and fiymaA bayona AlA^ay~aAmi: see nadorapN, in two places.

muyaAwamapN *
from Alyawomu is like mulaAyalapN from All~ayolu, and mu$aAharapN from Al$~ahoru, &c. (TA, in art. rbE.) See musaAwaEap.

2 yay~ayotu yaA='F HasanapF *
[I wrote a beautiful Y]. (TA, in art. HY.)
